99% off all treshs suck at lasthits, despite the E, so either thresh gets little money as he can't use his stacks, or his adc tries to leaf him some, but tresh fails and the adc looses on cs.

But most off all, if tresh uses his empowered AA on a minion, you can easily go for a trade as he looses~33% off his total damage potential...

I find the ADC often doesn't let him even try to last hit.
If a support can't 50-0 the minion, they're aren't allowed to have it.

This is especially annoying after lane phase. At which point you will never proc Targon's again.
And because you're desperately trying to get last hits before the ADC, you end up auto attacking early and the minion dies.

When you have 4 charges and the ADC uses a skill to kill the canon minion before your AA animation hits.

1. He has almost zero damage and is completely reliant on his team to follow up. He isnt going to blow you up like a "support" Lux

2. Heavily reliant on his hook which is easy to dodge. Hook has a long wind up time, narrow hit box, and slow missile speed

2. It is a narrow hit box. Funny how you didnt even attempt to address the other points

3. Obvious joke is obvious

Since you're not going to beleive me, have a look at the actual numbers

http://www.elophant.com/league-of-legends/champions/damage-dealt

I've been playing thresh recently, and this doesn't happen too often. If I don't land the hook directly on them it usually won't hit them. I've narrowly missed it several times and watched my hook fly by them. I think it has more to do with the specific champion hit boxes than his hook hit box.

Yeah that video is rubbish, the guy pauses it before the hook goes the full distance. 

At its full distance there, it in fact is close enough to snap onto Shaco. That's kind of how hitboxes work.

I'm pretty sure most hitboxes don't have magnets in them. I play Blitz and Nid a pretty good amount, and I've never seen my skillshots snap onto enemies like how Thresh's does. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z6btvVYoxOY

"Snapping" is part of the animation. 

It would look awkward if the hook was hanging on the side of someone's body while holding them in place.

Blitz and Nid don't need particle snapping for their skillshots because the total effect is instantaneous

Snapping is, indeed, part of the animation. It would, indeed, look awkward if his hook just hung on the side of somebody's body. But it looks so much more awkward when his hook hitbox opens up at max range to hit things anywhere. It's insanely hard to dodge something when the skillshot you're trying to dodge has such a weird and uncommunicated hitbox.

1. Play Sona sometime. She hurts in lane without even trying

That just plays part in an overloaded kit that makes a champion OP. Blitz can't engage on a whole team with his QER, Leona can't turn fights around by bringing in another ally or saving one from being killed. Morgana can't afford to build tanky.

Thresh doesnt put out nearly as much CC as Morg, let alone the black shield. Morg can also build tanky if she wants and still offer all the same utility. Plus Morg's Q has 3 times the hitbox as a hook and theres no wind up time

Blitz is about pulling one target to his team to delete them. Just because he doesnt have the same playstyle as thresh doesn't mean its worse. Blitz hooks absolutely can force a team fight though as well.

A flash Tibbers from Annie can single handedly win a teamfight. Thresh can force a fight but could be suiciding in. Thresh doesnt offer the same instant lock down as an Annie does. People can dodge his skillshots pretty easily and jump out of his box. Literally the only hard CC thresh offers is 1 second of hook

Thresh doesnt offer the same innate tankiness as a Leona. Leona's kit also doesnt rely on her ability to land a single skill shot on specific members of the enemy team. She can still line up a decent ult even if the zenith blade misses. Leona offers 3 forms of hard CC as opposed to Thresh's one
